edu.jhu.coe.PCFGLA
Class Grammar

java.lang.Object
  edu.jhu.coe.PCFGLA.Grammar
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HierarchicalGrammar
public class Grammar
extends Object
implements Serializable

Simple implementation of a PCFG grammar, offering the ability to look up rules by their child symbols. Rule probability estimates are just relative frequency estimates off of training trees.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Grammar

public Grammar(short[] nSubStates,
               boolean findClosedPaths,
               Smoother smoother,
               Grammar oldGrammar,
               double thresh)
Rather than calling some all-in-one constructor that takes a list of trees as training data, you call Grammar() to create an empty grammar, call tallyTree() repeatedly to include all the training data, then call optimize() to take it into account.

Parameters:
oldGrammar - This is the previous grammar. We use this to copy the split trees that record how each state is split recursively. These parameters are intialized if oldGrammar is null.

normalize

public void normalize()
Normalize the unary & binary probabilities so that they sum to 1 for each parent. The binaryRuleCounter and unaryRuleCounter are assumed to contain probabilities, NOT log probabilities!

matrixVectorPreMultiply

public double[][] matrixVectorPreMultiply(double[][] V,
                                          List<UnaryRule>[] M,
                                          List<Integer> possibleSt)
Assumption: A in possibleSt ==> V[A] != null. This property is true of the result as well. The converse is not true because of a workaround for part of speech tags that we must handle here.

Parameters:
V - (considered a row vector, indexed by (state, substate))
M - (a matrix represented in List[] (by parent) format)
possibleSt - (a list of possible states to consider)
Returns:
U=V*M (row vector)

matrixVectorPostMultiply

public double[][] matrixVectorPostMultiply(List<UnaryRule>[] M,
                                           double[][] V,
                                           List<Integer> possibleSt)
Assumption: A in possibleSt ==> V[A] != null. This property is true of the result as well. The converse is not true because of a workaround for part of speech tags that we must handle here.

Parameters:
M - (a matrix represented in List[] (by parent) format)
V - (considered a column vector, indexed by (state, substate))
possibleSt - (a list of possible states to consider)
Returns:
U=M*V (column vector)

splitRules

public void splitRules()
Populates the "splitRules" accessor lists using the existing rule lists. If the state is synthetic, these lists contain all rules for the state. If the state is NOT synthetic, these lists contain only the rules in which both children are not synthetic.

This method must be called before the grammar is used, either after training or deserializing grammar.

splitAllStates

public Grammar splitAllStates(short[] numNonInternalBeforeLatestCouple,
                              int[] givenOffset,
                              double randomness,
                              int[] counts,
                              boolean moreSubstatesThanCounts,
                              int mode)
Split all substates into two new ones. This produces a new Grammar with updated rules.

Parameters:
randomness - percent randomness applied in splitting rules
mode - 0: normalized (at least almost) 1: not normalized (when splitting a log-linear grammar) 2: just noise (for log-linear grammars with cascading regularization)
Returns:

totalSubStates

public int totalSubStates()

tallyMergeWeights

public void tallyMergeWeights(Tree<StateSet> tree,
                              double[][] mergeWeights)
Tally the probability of seeing each substate. This data is needed for tallyMergeScores. mergeWeights is indexed as [state][substate]. This data should be normalized before being used by another function.

Parameters:
tree -
mergeWeights - The probability of seeing substate given state.

normalizeMergeWeights

public void normalizeMergeWeights(double[][] mergeWeights)

tallyMergeScores

public void tallyMergeScores(Tree<StateSet> tree,
                             double[][][] deltas,
                             double[][] mergeWeights)
Calculate the log likelihood gain of merging pairs of split states together. This information is returned in deltas[state][merged substate]. It requires mergeWeights to be calculated by tallyMergeWeights.

Parameters:
tree -
deltas - The log likelihood gained by merging pairs of substates.
mergeWeights - The probability of seeing substate given state.

mergeStates

public Grammar mergeStates(boolean[][][] mergeThesePairs,
                           double[][] mergeWeights)
This merges the substate pairs indicated by mergeThesePairs[state][substate pair]. It requires merge weights calculated by tallyMergeWeights.

Parameters:
mergeThesePairs - Which substate pairs to merge.
mergeWeights - The probability of seeing each substate.
